thread.title: Hackett: Stourbridge were comfortable

title: Hackett: Stourbridge were comfortable
text:
Tweet 
The Glassboys reached the first round proper for the fourth time in seven seasons after brushing aside their non-league rivals at the War Memorial Ground. 
Goals from Matt Dodd and Justin Richards put the hosts two up inside the first 15 minutes before Chris Lait added a third in the second-half. 
Stour made a mockery of the two division gap between the two clubs. Harriers, who are currently bottom of the National League Premier, remain without a win this season. 
And Hackett said: “It was surprisingly comfortable, though I don’t want to take anything away from our players, they were outstanding. 
“We had a gameplan and stuck to it. We looked a threat throughout the whole game and even if we had won by another one or two it would not have flattered us. 
“It’s difficult but I think Kidderminster must be very disappointed with the way they played.” 
Stourbridge previously reached the first round in 2009, 2011 and 2013, going on to reach the second round on the latter two occasions. 
Hackett added: “It is fantastic, I think we waited 130 years to get there for the first time, it has been an amazing achievement. 
“It has been a great day for us, everyone involved at the club. I have always said once you have a taste of it, you want more. More on this story:
